channel.title: Network on Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Network on Blog

item.title: Socat - host forwarding
item.description: So I have a situtation that there is MySQL instance running at 198.168.100.100:34357. The host IP is difficult to remember, the port number is just something random. It would be easier for me to receive all traffics for MySQL at some localhost:3306 port. 3306 is the default port for MySQL. And the fact that I’m using OSX makes things a bit harder, the nc netcat in OSX doesn’t work the same way as Linux nc.
